name: Mt-Aligner
tagline: Open Source effort to create a Machine Translation based Alignment tool. Also known as Mount Aligner.
body:
### Welcome to MT Aligner (mount aligner)
This automatic Translation Memory and Machine Translation Engine trainer is an experimental project. The concept is based on seeding a Machine Translation Engine (SMT-based) with an unreliable corpus (the source text) and a parallel unreliable output model (target text). 

The corpus files are "auto-aligned" using [Hunalign](https://github.com/danielvarga/hunalign) or similar tools [LF align](http://sourceforge.net/projects/aligner/) that generate information about the source and target texts--however, unlike these tools, the goal is not *only* a Translation Memory for later re-use, but a training set of data for an MT engine. 

Eventually, a mock-training set can be generated by the MT engine and then the alignment tools used to verify/validate it. The objective is to create a reliable language model for the parallel corpora not just a useful artifact (Translation Memory).

### Authors and Contributors
Currently a work in progress... You can be a contributor or guinea pig! 
please send a note to @nihowma for more details. I am doing this on the side of my regular translation industry job, so if all of a sudden a passionate creator with plenty of time and talent on their hands wants to build, build, baby build! I won't be standing in the way. For the meantime this project continues.
